trs: He heard it and he went and went into the forest, going after the daughter.’\\
[He found her.] “Apparently you saw mother, so,{\footnotemark} tell her to bring me back!” she said to him,’\\
“Explain correctly to mother ...’”\\
“when you prepare it, make proper \textit{chicha} only for me ...”’\\
“and you mix separately for the fox-man only ...”’\\
“you mix in dog shit and chicken poop ...”’\\
“you put it inside a calabash by itself and bring it to me ...’”\\
“and for Agouti you separately put in maize porridge ...”’\\
“and you bring it to me,” I think she said.’\\
And then on the next day mother (went up onto the storage platform and) dropped maize (cobs) on the ground, so ...’\\
she finished preparing the \textit{chicha} and went to take it there.’\\
“If you go across a dry log” she would meet (her daughter),’\\
he (Agouti) having told her thus.’\\
